newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE, CUTS DIESEL PRICES.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE, CUTS DIESEL PRICES.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell Nederland BV said on Wednesday it will raise its retail prices for gasolines in the Netherlands by one cents per litre with effect from January 24.

It added it would cut the diesel price by one cent per litre from the same date. The moves reflect changes in international product prices and the value of the dollar against the guilder, the company said.
From Friday the price of premium unleaded gasoline at Shell's self-service stations goes up to 2.11 guilders per litre.
The price of premium with lead substitute rises to 2.18 guilders and that of Euro regular unleaded to 2.06 guilders.
The recommended price for diesel goes down to 1.518 guilders per litre, Shell said.
